definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Frank was very kind, manly, open-hearted .
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克體貼，坦率，有男子氣。

sentences.english: She likes you. Maybe she just wants you to be a man and do something.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡你，也許她希望你拿出男子氣，採取行動。

sentences.english: I want to fill my arms with your manly body.
sentences.chinese: 我很想把你男子氣的身體擁在我的懷裏。

sentences.english: They are unremittingly masculine, in the shallowest sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 從最淺顯的意義上說，他們非常男子氣。

sentences.english: No doubt there will be more macho photo-opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問還會有普金充滿男子氣的照片出現。
和你的男子氣揮手告別。

sentences.english: Macho heroes in films are bad role models for children.
sentences.chinese: 電影中那些大男子氣的英雄是不宜孩子們模仿的。

sentences.english: Too macho or scared to see a doctor?
sentences.chinese: 太男子氣或害怕去看醫生？
